org.raistlic.common.assertion

Interface CollectionAssertion<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the actual element type of the Collection candidate.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Assertion<java.util.Collection<E>,CollectionAssertion<E>>

    public interface CollectionAssertion<E>
extends Assertion<java.util.Collection<E>,CollectionAssertion<E>>
    Defines useful expectations around Collection candidates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CollectionAssertion<E> contains(E element)
      Checks that the collection contains the specified element , or otherwise throws an exception.
      CollectionAssertion<E> contains(E element, java.lang.String message)
      Checks that the collection contains the specified element , or otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .
      CollectionAssertion<E> containsAll(java.util.Collection<E> elements)
      Checks that the collection contains all of the specified elements, or otherwise throws an exception.
      CollectionAssertion<E> containsAll(java.util.Collection<E> elements, java.lang.String message)
      Checks that the collection contains all of the specified elements, or otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .
      CollectionAssertion<E> hasSize(int size)
      Checks that the collection has the specified size , or otherwise throws an exception.
      CollectionAssertion<E> hasSize(int size, java.lang.String message)
      Checks that the collection has the specified size , or otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .
      CollectionAssertion<E> isEmpty()
      Checks that the collection candidate is empty, or otherwise throws an exception.
      CollectionAssertion<E> isEmpty(java.lang.String message)
      Checks that the collection candidate is empty, or otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .
      CollectionAssertion<E> isNullOrEmpty()
      Checks that the collection is either null or empty, otherwise throws an exception.
      CollectionAssertion<E> isNullOrEmpty(java.lang.String message)
      Checks that the collection is either null or empty, otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .
      CollectionAssertion<E> isOrderedBy(java.util.Comparator<? super E> comparator, java.lang.String message)
      Checks that the collection is sorted by the specified comparator , or otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .
      CollectionAssertion<E> notEmpty()
      Checks that the collection is empty, otherwise throws an exception.
      CollectionAssertion<E> notEmpty(java.lang.String message)
      Checks that the collection is empty, otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .

      • containsAll

        CollectionAssertion<E> containsAll(java.util.Collection<E> elements)
        Checks that the collection contains all of the specified elements, or otherwise throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        elements - the elements that the collection candidate is expected to contain, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the expectation instance itself, for fluent call.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when elements is null.

      • containsAll

      • isOrderedBy

        CollectionAssertion<E> isOrderedBy(java.util.Comparator<? super E> comparator,
                                   java.lang.String message)
        Checks that the collection is sorted by the specified comparator , or otherwise throws an exception with the specified message .
        Parameters:
        comparator - the comparator that the collection candidate is expected to be sorted by, cannot be null.
        message - the message to throw exception with, when the check fails.
        Returns:
        the expectation instance itself, for fluent call.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when comparator is null.
